results.title: Teenage crises: fateful choices
results.creator_credit: Human Relations Media, Linda Atkinson and Nick Doob
results.brief_description: This hard-hitting documentary addresses many of the significant problems encountered by today’s youth: addiction, violence, pregnancy, AIDS and depression/suicide. “Teenage crises” attempts to shake up the notion of teen invincibility by talking to young people who have come through hard times, including Olympic gold medal swimmer Nelson Deibel, an ex-drug addict. Stresses the importance of finding positive role models and being secure enough to make the right choices.

results.title: Teenage challenges
results.creator_credit: Lesley Purdy, David P. Stone and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 24 of Series “Time to grow”.
Adolescence is a time of stressful change for teenagers often due to higher expectations, increased social pressures and more responsibilities. Approximately 20% will have trouble in coping and some will never recover from the traumatic effects of this period in their life. The majority however, through family and adult support and care will weather the storm. Divorce can be a major influencing factor in teenage anti-social behaviour. This program helps provide an understanding of this and other issues such as teenage pregnancy, anorexia/bulimia, dropping out of school and drug and alcohol abuse, through frank and open interviews with several young teenagers experiencing the challenges of adolescence.

results.title: Teenage blues
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
An episode on boredom, boredom and more boredom. Teenagers, in a set of comic sketches, explore the “nowhere to go, nothing to do syndrome”. Once they take up the challenge of organising the school social, they realise that a creative and positive approach to overcoming boredom can solve the problem.

results.title: Teenage Babylon
results.brief_description: Restaging 1950s and 1960s forensic photographs, director Graeme Wood explores the meanings, memories and possible stories that were undetected at the time. These intimate and poetic portraits reveal how the distance of time itself alters and reconfigures the actual space and meaning of the photograph.

results.title: Teen suicide
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Research Group Limited, Charlotte Angel, Kyle Boyd and Matt Clark
results.brief_description: This program looks at the reasons troubled teenagers consider, attempt or commit suicide. There is an emphasis on recognising the warning signs, the importance of communication, preventative measures and where to go to help. The program features interviews with teenagers who offer insights into the reasons why they felt suicidal and how they dealt with their situations.

results.title: Teddy bears at play [1959]
results.creator_credit: Australian National Travel Association, Mel F. Nichols and Winifred Lade
results.brief_description: A re-issue of a 1939 film, famous for its intimate study of the koala. This quaint and friendly creature with its soft round furry body is the most popular of Austrlia’s unique animals. Photographed by Mel. F. Nichols, edited by Winifred Lade.

results.title: Teddy
results.brief_description: A youthful African American man and his fight for equality for himself and for others through education. He goes to community meetings at South Park and connects with the fringe of the Black Panthers.

results.title: Ted: The Kite Man
results.brief_description: Ted the kite man is a Port Fairy icon. A long time resident, Ted has a kite shop, a big heart, and a contagious philosophy as he encourages kids to explore the winds and the outdoors flying their kites. He and his partner build kites with 3,000 children a year and he believes flying a kite helps you forget all your concerns of the day while participating in this peaceful activity.
